messages.content: What temperament are INFJs?

INFJs are Idealists. They're part of the NF temperament - intuitive feelers who focus on social change through innovation. Gandhi, Buddha, Jesus Christ, Martin Luther King - all INFJs. They see human suffering clearly and execute change to fix it.
What's the difference between NFPs and NFJs?

NFPs advocate for change - they reshape what people believe. They're the visionaries painting a picture of a better future. NFJs execute change - they bring those visions to life in organizations, communities, churches. NFPs dream it, NFJs build it. Both drive social transformation, just from different angles.
Why are NFPs good at sales?

Because they don't sell facts - they sell belief systems. NFPs excel at conveying messages of a brighter future. They reshape how you think, what you believe is possible. That's way more powerful than metrics. They change minds, not just present data.
What's the Idealist temperament code?

NF - intuitive feelers. That's ENFJ, ENFP, INFJ, INFP. They're all about people and social change. While intellectuals focus on systems and guardians focus on stability, idealists focus on transforming society for the better.
How do NFJs and NFPs work together?

It's a perfect cycle. The NFP sees the suffering and designs a vision for change. The NFJ partner implements that vision. Back and forth - endless social transformation. They feel alive doing this together because they're united in bringing change to humanity.
Why do idealists value relationships so much?

Because they're people-focused at their core. They deeply understand human suffering. NFJs especially will self-sacrifice to extreme levels - sometimes becoming overly accommodating. One INFJ literally went to jail for shoplifting to help a stranger in need. That's how far idealists go for people.
What percentage of the population are idealists?

They're at the top of the pyramid - the smallest percentage. Guardians make up 40% at the base, artisans 30% in the next layer, then intellectuals, and idealists sit at the pinnacle. They're the spearhead determining the direction of human existence.
What careers do NFs typically choose?

People-focused occupations. Nursing, clergy, activism, education, volunteer work. ENFJs often go into politics. Both INFPs and ENFJs thrive in education because they want to instigate change in students for broader societal impact. They understand the ripple effect of their influence.
How are NFPs and NFJs connected mentally?

NFPs have an NFJ shadow or unconscious side. NFJs have an NFP shadow. This mental overlap lets them share similar objectives and expertise. An NFP could execute change like an NFJ, but it takes more effort and time. Same reversed - an NFJ could envision like an NFP, just requires more energy.
What's the difference between SFJs and NFJs in helping professions?

SFJs focus on protection and care - that's why social work is typically SFJs. NFJs aim to create a better world for everyone. SFJs protect what is, NFJs transform what could be. Different vectors, different focus, but both helping people.
Why are guardians resistant to idealist change?

Because guardians - the SJ types - make up 40% of the population and they're highly resistant to change by nature. They value stability and tradition. Meanwhile, intuitive feelers are the drivers of social change. It creates natural tension when idealists push transformation.
What historical figures were idealists?

Gandhi, Buddha, Jesus Christ, Martin Luther King - all INFJs. Throughout history, people who significantly impacted spirituality, social interactions, civil rights, feminism, and human rights have often been intuitive feelers. They're the ones who changed how society functions.
Can an ENFJ create large-scale change?

Absolutely. ENFJs are executors of change. Take the example of an ENFJ forming a coalition of churches, establishing a nonprofit, raising funds, and building a hospital that brought 1,500-3,000 jobs to a community. That's macro-level execution. NFJs bring visions to life at any scale.
What makes idealists feel most alive?

Social change. When NFs unite to bring transformation to humanity, that's when they feel alive. It's different from intellectuals who feel alive collaborating on systems change. For idealists, it's about improving the world for present and future generations - that people-centric mission drives them.
Why do intuitives prefer other intuitives?

Because they share the same focus. NFs prefer NFs, NTs prefer NTs. Intuitives are abstract and future-oriented. Sensors prefer sensors because they're concrete and present-focused. It's about shared worldview - you naturally gravitate toward people who see reality the same fundamental way you do.
What's an example of INFP-driven change?

An INFP initiated an education initiative - raising funds to support low-income families in educating their children and securing scholarships. That's classic NFP advocacy. They saw a problem, envisioned a better future, and reshaped the belief system around education access. Vision-driven change.
How do idealists differ from intellectuals in their approach?

Idealists prioritize people. Intellectuals prioritize systems. Both can reach the same goal of helping others, but from different vectors. An NT builds a technological solution or systematic approach. An NF focuses on the human element and social transformation. Different paths, similar destinations.
What types are in the Idealist temperament?

ENFJ, ENFP, INFJ, INFP. That's the Mentor, the Advocate, the Sage, and the Dreamer. All intuitive feelers focused on social change and people. They're activists, foundation creators, and community builders who want to transform society.
Why would an NFJ struggle with envisioning change?

Because their strength is execution, not vision. An NFJ could envision change, but it would take more time and mental energy than just implementing someone else's vision. Their ego is built for bringing ideas to life - not necessarily creating those ideas from scratch. That's why NFJ-NFP partnerships work so damn well.
What drives idealists to volunteer work?

Their deep understanding of human suffering and their people-focused nature. INFJs are often at homeless shelters. ENFJs raise funds for hospitals. INFPs create educational initiatives. They see pain in the world and they can't just sit with it - they have to transform it. That's core to who they are.
